intro: Litobrochia raddiana, commonly known as the rock brochium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
